description: Dive into ‚ÄúUnderwater Adventures: India's Top Scuba Diving Destinations‚Äù ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Underwater Adventures: India's Top Scuba Diving Destinations

places.generalDescription: One of the most famous scuba diving sites, The Aravind Wall is located 15 km offshore. One can see a number of different and unique sea creatures.
places.name: Sri Aurobindo Ashram

reviews.text: I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect when I visited the Sri Aurobindo Ashram, but I was pleasantly surprised. It‚Äôs not your typical tourist spot it‚Äôs quiet, no photography allowed, and very respectful. I learned a lot about Sri Aurobindo and The Mother. The bookshop nearby has some great spiritual and philosophical reads. Definitely worth stopping by if you‚Äôre curious about Indian spirituality or just want a break from the beach crowd.

We went to meditate in the ashram in the morning üåÖ on Sunday. Lots of people come and go. Nowadays the weather is a bit hot and there are lots of trees surrounded by nice air.
The sea is also near if anybody wants them to go immediately. If anybody wants to eat breakfast ü•û lunch or dinner they have to make tickets. mobiles are kept silent üîï and sleeper are kept in front of the ashram.

Good to visit to see the Samadhi and come out in a few minutes. As seen in other reviews, the staff is very rude. There is a bookstore towards the exit. I switched on my phone to pay for the books, and picked a call which was urgent of my family, the staff gave me a lecture that had the management seen they would have taken my phone for 2 hours.

What kind of kiddish behaviour is this? How do we pay for the books if not cash.

Sri Aurobindo Ashram is a peaceful and spiritually uplifting place in the heart of Pondicherry. The atmosphere is calm and deeply meditative. Visitors are expected to maintain silence, which enhances the serenity of the space. The samadhi (final resting place) of Sri Aurobindo and The Mother is surrounded by flowers and devotion. It's a place to pause, reflect, and experience inner stillness. Ideal for those seeking peace, simplicity, and a deeper connection to spiritual thought. Mobile phones need to be switched off inside the ashram to maintain the peaceful environment. There‚Äôs also a small bookshop where you can explore or purchase books by The Mother and Sri Aurobindo.

Very calm, peaceful place. Phones are not allowed to be switched on inside. People come here to meditate as even the guides don't speak in there. Very peaceful place. You need to remove your shoes before going in. There is a shoe stand right opposite the entrance where you can keep your shoes at free of cost.

places.address: and, No. 9, Marine Street, White Town, Puducherry, 605002, India

places.generalDescription: With its diverse marine life, vibrant coral reefs, and clear waters, Goa offers an enticing experience for both novice and experienced divers.
places.name: Grand Island Trip Goa

reviews.text:
Grand Island Tour ‚Äì A Paradise for Adventure Lovers! üåäüö§

The Grand Island Tour is an unforgettable experience for those who love the sea, adventure, and scenic beauty! üèùÔ∏è‚ú® The stunning beaches and crystal-clear waters make it a perfect getaway. People here enjoy a variety of thrilling water activities, including banana boat rides, scuba diving, jet skiing, speed boating, and many more! üö§ü§øüèÑ

But the highlight of the trip is parasailing‚Äîfloating high above the sea with the wind in your hair is absolutely breathtaking! ü™Çüòç If you're lucky, you might even spot playful dolphins swimming in the ocean! üê¨üíô Every moment here is full of excitement and adventure, making it a must-visit place for thrill-seekers and beach lovers! üåûüåä‚ú®

We booked dolphin tour at 4 pm and we did see few dolphins. You have to be very attentive as they just expose only 20% of their body and their color kind of mixes with the sea water. All we could see was fins and tail fins but that's better than nothing... even if you don't see the dolphins, you can still enjoy the boat ride... it's not expensive... 250 to 350 based on the season.

I wanted a break from my usual work routine and I wanted to go on a trip with my friend's, but something that would be worth the time, and within my budget. We stayed there for 2 nights and 3 days. We tried snorkeling, diving, banana ride, and so much more. On our last day, once we were done with lunch and a little shopping, we even booked a yacht along with 3 other people, and this experience was much better than other boat trips in Goa. All in all, the whole trip was really good. We are back feeling refreshed, and ready to work harder for another trip! I would highly recommend Goa to everyone, but ensure visiting in winters. The chilled sea water and warm sun rays falling on your face feels surreal and blissful.

It's a Island in Southern part of Goa and a major spot to perform Scuba Diving while you are in Goa. Though the depth of sea near this Island is not too much, you can enjoy the scuba diving sport. You can have a view to bottom of sea where you can find rocky base and some small beautiful fishes.
The water here is fresh and blue.

Most of the water adventure company of Goa take their customers to this Island for scuba diving and it is nearly half an hour ride from North Goa in speed boat.

Did my first scuba diving experience at Grand island 3 weeks back..it was awesome..Scuba and parasailing is worth paying..beach was very neat and clean with calm and tranquil surroundings..arrangements was very good..food was good..Loved the trip

places.address: near Old Petrol Pump, Khobra Waddo, Calangute, Goa 403516, India

places.generalDescription: Neil Islands is another part of Andaman which is just as beautiful albeit with less hustle and bustle. The coral reef here is quite untouched by external factors and hence retains its beauty owing to the rich variety of marine life.
places.name: Shaheed Dweep

reviews.text:
There are many heavens in India üòç. This place is one among them. Beautiful and wonderful place. This small island is totally around 9 km. A long road  which connects both the ends of the island. This road is a beautiful one with lots of century old trees on both sides. In my whole Andaman trip this place is very close to my heart.  A serene beach, beautiful place, not a crowded one with calm environment, loved ones near you, what to do you want more! Just pack your bags and go there with yout loved ones. Since there will be trouble getting phone signals there you will have much time to enjoy with your loved ones. Perfect place for honeymoon couples.  Still I couldn't forget the bluish green water, the white sand, centuries old trees standing tall, the sound of waves.....
Couldn't explain more......  Each and every small things in this island is beautiful..

Lastly please dont miss the sunrise and sunset.. ‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§

Beautiful island with all water sports activities......cheaper than elephant island.  Can bargain on the pricing. Amazingly clear water , excellent soft sand beach. Great food on the beach too. Shops for memorabilia and other shopping.  Bargaining a must. Excellent experience.

Neil Island, located in the Andaman and Nicobar archipelago, is a paradise for nature enthusiasts.
One of its most remarkable attractions is the Natural Bridge, a stunning rock formation that stands as a testament to the island's unique geological features.

The Natural Bridge, also known locally as "Howrah Bridge," is a natural rock formation that has been shaped over thousands of years by the relentless forces of the ocean.

The bridge is formed from the erosion of sedimentary rocks, creating an arch-like structure that frames the bright blue sky and the vibrant green foliage that grows atop it.
The base of the bridge is adorned with a variety of marine life, including colourful corals and unique sea creatures that thrive in the tidal pools.

To visit the Natural Bridge, it is recommended to plan your trip during low tide. This allows for safe and easy access to the bridge and the surrounding area.
The rocky terrain can be challenging, so wearing sturdy footwear is advisable.

The path to the bridge offers breathtaking views of the coastline, with the waves crashing against the rocks and the tranquil beauty of the ocean.

The Natural Bridge is a protected area, and visitors are encouraged to respect the environment.
Avoid touching or disturbing the marine life, and refrain from leaving any litter behind.

Thank Youüòä

This Island is for the Nature bridge views   with stone on beach side.

Good to visit for one Day.

Stayed for 2D/1N at Break Water Beach Resort and Restaurant. Amazing views of the sea with water activities like scuba diving, glass bottom boat ride, snorkeling etc. Souvenir shops along the adjacent road, blue-green water, long line of eateries. Cabs available near the jetty, both prebooked and for spot-booking. The main market deeper inside the island has a lot of shops for daily needs. A number of resorts have sprung up. Prominent beaches include Bharatpur and Lakshmanpur beaches, the former for bathing and water sports, the latter for the natural bridge and exposed coral reefs

places.address: Shaheed Dweep, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744104

places.generalDescription: This spot has one of the clearest waters in the world. With clarity up to 80 feet, this place makes for one of the most amazing scuba diving places.
places.name: Cinque Island
places.address: Cinque Island, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, India

places.generalDescription: Scuba diving in Havelock Island offers an exhilarating underwater experience. With numerous dive sites around the island, divers can explore vibrant coral reefs, diverse marine life, and the clear blue waters of the Andaman Sea.
places.name: Swaraj Dweep

reviews.text: Beautiful place with many treasures inside. Happy to see many Honeymoon couples there. Very peaceful place for the mind and soul. The evenings are amazing. The turquoise blue green colour water takes you aback.  There are many water sports activities to explore. It was a great experience.

Best place to spend vacation
Must go island
Very peaceful.
If you are beach person you will be loving it. No words can explain the beauty it has.
The journey to visit this island is a different experience one must try in their lifetime

One of the best places with beta views, amazing sunsets and crystal clear water, definitely visit this place in India. The island is so beautiful I fell in love with it. It's definitely incredible India. A big request to tourists is to not litter and spread your garbage, keep it clean and amazing the way nature has given us.

The incredible place also known as Swaraj Island, Havelock Island is a part of Ritchie‚Äôs Archipelago in the Andamans. Its dazzling white sand beaches and fascinating coral reefs are admired by nature lovers from around the world. #Andaman& Nicobar üèÇü™ÇüèÑüèñÔ∏èüèùÔ∏èüåèüåé

Havelock Beach, located on Havelock Island in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, is a breathtakingly beautiful destination. This tropical paradise boasts an expansive stretch of powdery white sand, gently sloping into the turquoise waters of the Bay of Bengal, which are renowned for their exceptional clarity, making it an ideal spot for snorkeling and scuba diving. The atmosphere is tranquil and peaceful, with the soothing sounds of waves gently lapping against the shore, and the beach transforms into a kaleidoscope of colors during the stunning sunsets, painting the sky in hues of orange, pink, and purple, leaving visitors spellbound and enchanted...

places.address: Swaraj Dweep, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744211

places.generalDescription: Kovalam is slowly developing into a popular scuba diving locale since the Bond Safari Kovalam has come there. Instead of using the traditional scuba gear, the company makes use of an underwater scooter.
places.name: Kovalam

places.generalDescription: Bangaram is known for its serene and calm atmosphere. The underwater scenic beauty is simply stunning with the continuous coral reef.
places.name: Bangaram

places.generalDescription: The capital city of the Union Territory has some amazing places to go to for scuba diving. The Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park in Wandoor is one of a unique place reserved to protect the marine flora and fauna.
places.name: Sri Vijaya Puram
places.address: Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, India

places.generalDescription: One of the most flexible scuba diving spots of Pondicherry is the cool sharks' reef. This is so named because it has a depth of the sea that varies from 5m to 23m.
places.name: Chakra Divers Pondy Private Limited

reviews.text: Scuba diving is such a unique experience. It was my first dive at Chakra Divers. I felt confident with the instructors at Chakra Divers guiding. It was my first wonderful experience. The world beneath the blue was awesome... Thanks to Chakra Divers...

10/10 recommend diving with them if/when you're in Pondicherry, India. Warm people, right from the reception to the boat. Instructors and all diving crew will help you learn well, have fun and also share great recommendations for off-dive time in the city. Great diving facility with professional-grade and well-maintained gear. They've two pools for training different levels too. Great harbour location as well. They have two boats to venture out. The boat snacks packed by akka are sustainably packed in tiffin boxes and are just what you need after a tiring dive: tomato cucumber sandwiches, some dry cake, a tiny spicy biscuit and a juice can! You can have more if you're hungry (I know I was).

Took my sister for her first discover dive with them and they did NOT disappoint. Went in June 2025. They include photos and videos from the dive as well, which was much appreciated!

I did my rescue, deep and nitrox courses with them. The artificial reef in Pondy is refreshing to see. Hundreds of fish out there: bat fish, blue streak fusiliers, black triggerfish, barracudas(!) and 2 cobias we mistook for little sharks as well xD The ravines and net caves were also interesting dive sites to see. Lots of coral on that tabletop.

All in all, a great time diving with Chakra. Definitely recommend going with them.

I completed my technical diving courses here and had an excellent experience. Pushpak's depth of knowledge, experience, and skill was truly impressive. The entire team was great - professional, supportive, and fun. I really appreciate their process oriented operations, as well as the well-maintained facilities and a lot of equipment. Overall, a delightful and highly satisfying experience. Highly recommend!

Last week, I ticked scuba diving off my bucket list  and wow, what an experience! üê†üí¶

From the very start, the whole team was super supportive ‚Äì right from the pool training to the actual dive. Our instructors Manisha and Siddharth were absolute stars ‚Äì patient, clear in their instructions, and kept the mood light so we never felt nervous, even as first-timers.

They gave us proper pool training before heading out, teaching exactly how to handle the equipment and what to do if anything unusual happens underwater. All the gear was in great condition, and both of them made sure safety always came first.

The dive itself lasted about 35 minutes (9 meters deep!) and honestly, it felt like entering another world ‚Äì colourful fish, calm waters, and that magical underwater silence.

Oh, and fun fact ‚Äì neither me nor my friend can swim. Still, thanks to Manisha and Siddharth, we felt completely safe and confident the whole time.

They even served refreshments after the dive, which was the perfect ending to a day of feeling like underwater explorers. üåä

If you‚Äôve never tried scuba diving before, do it at least once in your life ‚Äì and if you‚Äôre in Pondicherry, go with Chakra Divers. And if you‚Äôre lucky, you‚Äôll get Manisha and Siddharth as your dive buddies ‚Äì trust me, you‚Äôll be in the best hands!

This was my first time scuba diving, and I was incredibly happy! What an amazing experience underwater..‚ú® Heartfelt thanks to the Chakra Divers team for keeping us safe and providing loving care throughout the dive.

places.address: No: 16 & 18, 1st Cross, A, Kasturibai Gandhi St, Colas Nagar, Puducherry, 605001, India

places.generalDescription: Netrani Island, also known as Pigeon Island, is a beautiful diving spot, shaped in the form of a heart, fondly known as 'The heart of India's diving'.
places.name: Netrani Island

reviews.text:
Passed by this island on a ship
It was a beautiful view from the ship

Located remote from the main land
The beauty was astonishing and at the same time giving thrills

Can reach this island via boat ferries during summer season
During monsoon times it's mostly closed
If you get a chance do visit this island

And please don't litter

Krabi feels in India. A fabulous site and India's hidden gem for scuba diving. The water is crystal clear and offers amazing visibility. There are multiple diving & snorkelling  sites around the island- Nursery, Pebble Beach, Dive Goddess, Grotto, and more. On a lucky day you can even spot some black tip reef sharks here. You will reach the island by boat/ ferry from Murudeshwar beach in the morning and return the same evening. People are not allowed on the island.

Netrani Island is an absolute paradise for scuba diving enthusiasts. Starting from the boat journey to the island, it's is a delightful experience in itself, offering a peaceful escape with blue sea all around and cool breeze. As you approach the island, the breathtaking views that unfold before your eyes are nothing short of heavenly. The waters around Netrani Island offer such pristine clarity. The crystal-clear waters make it an ideal location for scuba diving. My visit to Netrani Island was truly unforgettable. The overall experience was nothing short of amazing. From the tranquil boat ride to the captivating underwater adventures, it's a destination that leaves you with cherished memories. Whether you're an experienced diver or a beginner, this island offers something for everyone. One needs to get a good diving company and then they can enjoy all the pleasures under the water. In conclusion, Netrani Island is a must-visit destination for scuba diving enthusiasts and nature lovers alike. Its serene beauty, clear waters, and remarkable marine biodiversity make it a haven for those seeking a unique and exhilarating underwater experience. I can't recommend it enough; it's a slice of paradise waiting to be explored.

Clean and clear water , the corals and the types of fishes !! All over its a best place for snorkelling and also for scuba diving ! Whenever in murdeshwar must experience scuba here in netrani islands !
It's the best place for a beginner type scuba diving experience. It's around 1.5hrs away from Murdeshwar. You can take scuba diving packages starting from 3.5k

places.generalDescription: Kadmat Islands is a coral island belonging to the union territory of Lakshadweep. It is a home to the marine turtles and other exotic marine species.
places.name: Kadmat Island

reviews.text: Zoo underrated for its lush beauty and good experience. Had a great time wuth the water activities like Reef watching, Scuba diving, Snorkling and Kayaking.

Kadamat Island is a beautiful and peaceful destination in the Lakshadweep Islands. It is famous for its white sandy beaches, clear blue waters, and stunning coral reefs. The island is perfect for relaxing and enjoying water activities like snorkeling, scuba diving, and swimming. The lush green coconut trees add to its charm, and the calm atmosphere makes it an ideal getaway for nature lovers. Kadamat Island also offers a glimpse of local culture and traditions, making it a memorable experience for visitors.

Picture post card island, with unlimited access to kayaking and swimming in the turquoise blue water that lets you see to the bottom of the lagoon..  this is a great place to be in.. snorkelling and scuba diving adds to lifes experiences. dont miss it. if you have 10 things to do in life pl add this to it.

Kadmat
The Kadmat Island is long and narrow. It is only 0.57 km wide at the broadest point having maximum length of 11 km. It lies between 11¬∞ 10‚Ä≤ and 11¬∞ 16‚Ä≤ N latitude and 72¬∞ 45‚Ä≤ and 72¬∞ 48‚Ä≤ E longitude, having an area of 3.20 sq km. This island is at a distance of 407 km (220 nautical mil from Kochi and located between Amini Island in the south and Chetlat Island in the north.

It has lagoon on the western side, measuring about 2 km at the broadest point with a total area of 37. sq km. The island is flat, rising 2 to 3 m in the east and 2 to 4 m in the west above the sea level. high ridge of sand runs down the western side of the island and also there is a sand accumulati on the southern part of the island, giving rise to undulations. The northern side is flat.

Kadmath is 8 Kms long and 550 metres wide at the broadest point. In addition to the beautiful shallow lagoon on the west that forms an ideal spot for water sports, there is a narrow lagoon on the east. The best attractions are the long sandy beaches and small sand banks on the southern tip for sun baths. Kadmath has been identified for staying tourists with its tourist huts aesthetically situated in the coconut palm groves in the beaches facing the lagoon. The place is ideal for a real holiday that brings you away from the maddening crowd, hustle and bustle of city life. You will certainly learn the art of disembarkation on the island around noon on the second day of the 6 days Marine Wealth Awareness Programme tour.
You spend 3 days enjoying sea breeze and moonlit beach. Water sports crafts like kayaks, pedal boats, sailing yachts, skiing boats and glass bottomed boats are available on hire. The scuba diving centre in the island has become an attraction for water-sport enthusiasts.

Climate
The climate of Kadmat is similar to the climatic conditions of Kerala. March to May is the hottest period of the year. The temperature ranges from 25oC to 35oC and humidity ranging from 70 -76 per cent for most of the year. The average rainfall received is 1600 mm a year. Monsoon prevails here from 15th May to 15th September. The monsoon period raises temperature to the mercury level between 27- 30 degrees. During the monsoon time, boats are not allowed outside the lagoon because of the violent sea. The presence of the reef maintains calm at the lagoon.

Island at a glance
Population (2011)	5389
Density (per Sq.km)	1727
Access by	Air and Sea from India,South-west coast.
Location	11¬∞- 13* North Latitude 72¬∞- 47* East longitude
Distance to Malabar coast	407 kms from Kochi
Total geographical Area	3.20 sq.Kms
Maximum Length	8 km
Width	550 meters
Temperature	32oC (Max.) to 28oC (Min.)
Humidity	70-75%
Highest Rainfall	241.8 mm.recorded in 24 hours
Literacy Rate	95.50

This Island is one of the best place to stay when you are visiting Laskhadweep. SPORTS has set up a excellent accommodation facility at the end of the Island where you are secluded from rest of the world. Rooms are right in front of the beach. Rooms are very well appointed and spacious. you can enjoy Scuba diving, Snorkelling, kayaking. It has Scuba diving training institute, you can get the various level certifications done. Its a must visit place once in a life time.
